page.title: 14A Day in the Life of Fiona
page.content: On Fridays I get up at 7. o'clock. I have toast for my breakfast. I feed my fish and then I hang the washing out for my Mum if it is not raining. At half past eight my Mum drives me to school. We go into school at quarter to nine and have assembly. We have maths before playtime and then do topic work afterwards. We have our lunch at quarter to twelve and then play outside until one o'clock. In the afternoon we go swimming at Retford Sports Centre. We finish our swimming session at two o'clock and go back to school on a coach. At school we read until home-time. I then go to another swimming training session. I get home at about six o'clock and have my tea. I am very tired.
